channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NM
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NM

item.title: Report X-2023100946
item.description:
Report X-2023100946

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-15T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-09
  • City: ALBUQUERQUE
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was mishandled during sortation from the truck to the belt. Package was removed from further sorting process and placed inside a plastic tote. DescribePack: Liquid was leaking from the lid. Further inspection showed the seal was not airtight. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed upright and inside a plastic tote.

item.title: Report X-2023100667
item.description:
Report X-2023100667

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-14T18:12:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-04
  • City: SANTA TERESA
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was loaded wrong in the nose of the tailer. It was found on its side on top of several other packages. Which were also damaged. Since it was acid we were unable to clean up in house and had to call a clean up crew. DescribePack: The cause of failure was found to be that the cap came loose. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: The cleaning crew recovered the package and all the packages that were damaged by it. It was put in a hazmat drum and put in the hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2023090455
item.description:
Report X-2023090455

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-09T00:32:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-30
  • City: BELEN
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PROX 12217 was found by a carmen to be leaking from the bottom of the tank during an outbound inspection. After investigation by BNSF Hazmat, it was determined that the leak was coming from the jacket, indicating a tank failure somewhere under the jacket. Approximately 50 gallons were recovered from containment pools. The car was moved to a siding after containment measures were put into place. The car was then transloaded into poly tanks while awaiting empty cars to arrive. The poly tanks were then transferred into two separate tank cars due to the smaller capacities than the original tank car.

item.title: Report X-2023090454
item.description:
Report X-2023090454

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-09T00:32:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-30
  • City: ENCINO
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SHQX 12053 was found to be leaking from the top of the car during an FRA inspection. Upon investigation by BNSF HazMat, the leak was noted as coming from the manway. The swing bolts were tool tight, however after opening the manway lid, the gasket was noted to be in bad condition along with a pinching of the gasket at the leak origin. The manway gasket was replaced and the swing bolts were tool-tightened.
